meanings.definition: Depending on a roll of a die or on chance; random.
meanings.sent1: The outcome of the game was aleatory, determined solely by luck.
meanings.sent2: The aleatory nature of the weather made it difficult to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: She laughed at the aleatory way her cat would chase shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Life can sometimes feel like an aleatory journey, full of unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The artist used aleatory brush strokes to create a unique and unpredictable masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to luck or chance.
meanings.sent1: The lucky charm was believed to have aleatory powers to bring good fortune.
meanings.sent2: Her success in the competition was more aleatory than planned.
meanings.sent3: The aleatory meeting of old friends at the park brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: In the aleatory world of business, one must be prepared for unexpected opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The dice rolled in an aleatory manner, leaving the outcome uncertain until the last moment.
